text:
Hi everyone,
I've always wondered if it's possible to render all custom modules' fields as standalone simple modules in web templates. For instance, in a custom module you can use text fields among the others. The counterpart for web templates are:
`{% module "text" path="@HubSpot/text" label="test-text", value="Test here" %}`
`{% text "simple_text_field" label="Enter text here", value="This is the default value for this text field" %}`
By the way, I still can't figure out what's the difference between the two above. Any hints?

Similarly one can add to templates other fields, like booleans, colors ecc. Is it possible to do the same for a date module? Or a link?
I tried the last one like this
```    {% link "test-link" label="test link", export_to_template_context=True, link={
    "url": {
      "type": "EXTERNAL",
      "href": "www.HubSpot.com"
    },
    "open_in_new_tab": false,
    "no_follow": false
    } %}```
but I see the error shown in the attached image. How to fix this?

For the date module, specifically, is it possible to achieve this?
Thanks.
cc <@U04AQA0QM8E>
